Content: Aura upgrades include upgrades like Fire Brand and Vacuum Aura.
Bonus buff upgrades include stronger rare ones like Rage, Seeker, and Perseverance Mastery.
If not disabled, enemies will gain a random amount of bonus skills.
Enable the main group of upgrades, including anything from Rested to Death Resist.
Enable class upgrades. These are upgrades that provide a set of abilities and skills, such as Hydroshocker.
Enable enemy duplication. Depending on duplication settings, enemies may gain duplicate copies in battle that grant special loot.
Enable level scaling. Enemies and NPCs will be leveled up to the set modifier (+1 level higher than the party etc.).
Hardmode grants enemies bonus upgrades and enables specific challenges in various sections of the game.
Enemies will get additional upgrades by rolling between the minimum and maximum values set to determine bonus rolls. Each roll runs through the upgrade system to see if they get any upgrades.
Enable immunity upgrades, including upgrades that grant full resistance or evasion.
Enable bonus rewards on enemies that scale to their "Challenge Point" value. Enemies with more difficult upgrades gain more challenge points, and have a higher chance to drop better loot.
Enable summoning upgrades, such as Totemancer.

If enabled, voidwoken have a chance to spawn when casting source skills. This chance increases depending on the source cost, and total source points used in a level, which naturally degrades over time.
Enable restricting the highest level an enemy can be leveled up to when scaling them per the level modifier. This is not recommended, as leveling past 35 can crash the game.
The level modifier used when leveling enemies up (+2 higher than the party's level etc.).
The minimum amount of bonus upgrades to gain in hardmode. Hardmode bonus upgrades will be a random value between the min and max.
The maximum amount of bonus upgrades to gain in hardmode. Hardmode bonus upgrades will be a random value between the min and max.
